intro: Stereocarpus dormoyanus, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a rhizomatous root system and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces a distinctive, fleshy, yellow fruit. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
